commit_list.message:
Fix #write_pointer when writing large value.

Error: `write_pointer': integer 10000000000 too big to convert to `int' (RangeError)

The max value of Fixnum is now based on the _long_ type, at least the case for MRI Ruby.

commit_list.message:
Array: Assert in the Array2D's copy constructor to ensure it's not a self-copying.

For code such as "A a = a;", "a" will be initialized with the copy consructor of A,
and no default constructor will be called. This may not be intended.

The assertion in this patch tries to prevent this kind of initializations.

Signed-off-by: Shin Yee <cshinyee@gmail.com>

commit_list.message:
[FIX] Use a simpler method to cope with spaces in file/dir names.

By default,

	for i in $@ ; do
		# $i will contain broken file names (those with spaces).
		... $i
	done

Merely double quote the $@, need not use IFS=$'\n'.
See http://myxman.org/dp/node/167

	for i in "$@" ; do
		# "$i" gives complete file names.
		... "$i"
	done

Signed-off-by: Shin Yee <cshinyee@gmail.com>

commit_list.message:
[FIX] Remove syntax error - Mismatching "[" and "]".
[FIX] Solve space problems in scripts xman_dos2unix and xman_unix2dos.

BASH script -

	for file in $@

is unable to handle fils with space. Hence, I set IFS=$'\n' to solve the space problems.
